Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Editorial Board member Journal of Ethnobiology and Ethnomedicine.
Series editor in: Pieroni A, Pardo-de-Santayana M, Sõukand, R (Series Editors). 2017. Major Reference Work “European Ethnobotany” 6 volumes. Springer. [In press (Winter 2017)]. Approx. 3 000 pages.
Editorial Board member Journal of Ethnobiology

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: "Herbal remedies in written communication: the interpretation of the message." 10th World Congress of Semiotics, A Coruna, Spain

Main organiser of First Eastern-European regional workshop “Old treasures in the new Europe: the future of ethnobiology in the East and Far East”. Tallinn, Estonia 15–18 October 2010, 35 participants. Organized under official patronage of International Society of Ethnobiology. This established a tradition, as the 4th workshop will be organized in December 2016 in Krakow, Poland.
"Field Notebook as a Temporal Mnemonic Tool." Societat Catalana d'Historica de la Ciencia i de la Techica. 4th International Conference of the European Society for the History of Science. Barcelona
"From Repelling to Killing: Human-Insect Relationship in Estonian Folk Tradition." Conference Zoosemiotics and Animal Representations, Tartu, Estonia.

О возможности этноботанического анализа исторических фольклорных текстов на примере эстонской народной медицины. IX Конгресс этнографов и антропологов России. IX Конгресс этнографов и антропологов России. Петрозаводск, Russian Federation.
"Personal and shared herbal landscapes". International Society of Ethnobiology II. Regional Workshop on Eastern European Ethnobiology. Királyrét ("The meadow of the king"), Hungary

"Wild plants in Estonian food culture: outline of research sources." International Society of Ethnobiology II. Regional Workshop on Eastern European Ethnobiology. Királyrét ("The meadow of the king"), Hungary.

"Folk Medicine in Modern Herbals: Out of Context Generalizations." The 9th International Conference of Baltic Literary Scholars. From Past to Present: Transformations of Memory in Contemporary Culture; Tallinn, Estonia
"Changes in the use of wild food plants in Estonia". 13th Congress of the International Society of Ethnobiology, Montpellier, France.
“Popularisation of science: reliable interpretation of local knowledge". RAI Conference "Anthropology in the World" London, GB.
"Going green: The re-introduction of wild food plants into Estonian cuisine". The Return of Traditional Food SIEF 19th International Ethnological Food Research Conference Lund, Sweden

"Where Does the Border Lie: Local Plants Used for Making Tea for Recreation and/or Healing, 1970s-1990s Estonia". Society For Economic Botany 54th Annual Meeting. Plymouth University, Plymouth, England.
"Wild Plants Eaten in Childhood: Retrospective of 1970s-1990s Estonia." Society For Economic Botany 54th Annual Meeting. Plymouth University, Plymouth, England
"What Is a ‘Looduslik Taim’ (a ‘Wild Plant’) for Estonian Children. Framing Nature." Framing Nature: Signs, Stories, and Ecologies of Meaning. Tartu, Estonia.
"How a plant is chosen for food: reflections on the collection of wild plants for snacks in one’s childhood". 14th ISE (International Society of Ethnobiology) Congress, Bumthang, Bhutan
"From the Need to Acknowledged Choice: Changes in the Use of Wild Edible Plants in Estonia within the Last Two Centuries." Second World Congress of Environmental History. Guimarães, Portugal.

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Principle Investigator for research project “Preliminary study into identifying new medical herbs on the basis of folklore records”, awarded by Enterprise Estonia, EU27440. Budget: 12 659 EUR.

Principle Investigator for project “Increasing of scientific and educational capabilities and internationalization of humanitarian and social science institutions in Belarus”, awarded by Developmental grant by Foreign Ministry of Estonia Project no: 66-2015-A, Budget: 27 505 EUR.

Principle Investigator for prject: "Developmental cooperation between Estonian Literary Museum and Center of Belarusian Culture Studies, Language and Literature". Awarded by Developmental aid program by Foreign Ministry of Estonia. Budget: 50 680 EUR.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Medicine as culture – Department of Semiotics / University of Tartu / Estonia (3 ECTS). Conducted in E-learning format.
Cultural heritage – Institute of Agricultural and Environmental Sciences / Estonian University of Life Science (3 ECTS).
Introduction to ethnobotany – Institute of Agricultural and Environmental Sciences / Estonian University of Life Science / Estonia (6 ECTS). Conducted in E-learing and classroom format. 3 years.

Principle teaching scholar at Field School in Ethnobiology: intensive summer course “Designing and conducting ethnobiological research in Eastern Europe” Saaremaa, Estonia, June 29 – July 05, 2014. Institute of Agricultural and Environmental Sciences, Estonian University of Life Science, 5 ECTS, 22 post-grad students from 7 European countries, 7 teaching scholars. http://folklore.ee/ethnobio
Principle teaching scholar at field school "Methods in ethobiology" in Ljuban distrtict, Belarus, organized with Center of Belarusian Culture Studies, Language and Literature.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Uppsala Centre for Russian and Eurasian Studies / Uppsala University / Sweden. Main collaborator – Ingvar Svanberg. Non-formal collaboration on archival sources and their interpretation, comparative research. Coperation had so far resulted in four joint publications: 1) Svanberg I, Sõukand R (Editors) 2017. Volume Scandinavia and Baltic Countries. Major Reference Work “European Ethnobotany”. Springer. [In press (Winter 2017)]. Approx. 550 pages. 2) Sõukand R, Quave CL, Pieroni A, Pardo-de-Santayana M, Tardío J, Kalle R, Łuczaj Ł, Svanberg I, Kolosova V, Aceituno-Mata L, Menendez G, Kołodziejska-Degórska I, Pirożnikow E, Petkevičius R, Hajdari A, Mustafa B. 2013. Plants used for making recreational tea in Europe: a review based on specific research sites. Journal of Ethnobiology and Ethnomedicine 9: 58. 3) Łuczaj Ł, Pieroni A, Tardío J, Pardo-de-Santayana M, Sõukand R, Svanberg I, Kalle R. 2012. Wild food plant use in 21st century Europe: the disappearance of old traditions and the search for new cuisines involving wild edibles. Acta Societatis Botanicorum Poloniae, 81(4): 359–370. 4) Sõukand R, Kalle R, Svanberg I. 2010. Uninvited guests: traditional insect repellents in Estonia against Clothing Moths Tineola bisselliella, Human Fleas Pulex irritans and Bedbugs Cimex lectularius. Journal of Insect Science, 10:150.

Institute for Linguistic Studies / Russian Academy of Sciences / Russia. Main collaborator – Valeria Kolosova. Non-formal collaboration in the field of semantics and linguistics. Thus far the cooperation had resulted in one joint publication and another is under review: Sõukand R, Quave CL, Pieroni A, Pardo-de-Santayana M, Tardío J, Kalle R, Łuczaj Ł, Svanberg I, Kolosova V, Aceituno-Mata L, Menendez G, Kołodziejska-Degórska I, Pirożnikow E, Petkevičius R, Hajdari A, Mustafa B. 2013. Plants used for making recreational tea in Europe: a review based on specific research sites. Journal of Ethnobiology and Ethnomedicine 9: 58.

University of Gastronomic Sciences / Italy Major collaborator – Prof. Andrea Pieroni. Non-formal collaboration in the field of wild food and medicicinal plants. Have conducted several joint fieldworks in Estonia, Kosovo and Ukraine. Co-establised the Network of Eastern European Ethnobiology. The cooperation had so far resulted in six joint publications and several more are forthcoming: 1) Pieroni, A., Soukand, R., Quave, C. L., Hajdari, A., & Mustafa, B. (2017). Traditional food uses of wild plants among the Gorani of South Kosovo. Appetite, 108, 83-92. 2) Sõukand R, Pieroni A. 2016. The importance of a border: medical, veterinary, and wild food ethnobotany of the Hutsuls living on the Romanian and Ukrainian sides of Bukovina. Journal of Ethnopharmacology, 85: 17-40. 3) Sõukand, R., Pieroni, A., Biró, M., Dénes, A., Doğan, Y., Hajdari, A., ... & Łuczaj, Ł. 2015. An ethnobotanical perspective on traditional fermented plant foods and beverages in eastern Europe. Journal of Ethnopharmacology, 170(2015): 284–296. 4) Pardo-de-Santayana M, Quave CL, Sõukand R, Pieroni A. 2015. Medical ethnobotany and ethnopharmacology of Europe. Michael Heinrich, Anna Jäger (Eds.). Ethnopharmacology - a Reader.Wiley-Blackwell, pp 339–351. 5) Sõukand R, Quave CL, Pieroni A, Pardo-de-Santayana M, Tardío J, Kalle R, Łuczaj Ł, Svanberg I, Kolosova V, Aceituno-Mata L, Menendez G, Kołodziejska-Degórska I, Pirożnikow E, Petkevičius R, Hajdari A, Mustafa B. 2013. Plants used for making recreational tea in Europe: a review based on specific research sites. Journal of Ethnobiology and Ethnomedicine 9: 58. 6) Łuczaj Ł, Pieroni A, Tardío J, Pardo-de-Santayana M, Sõukand R, Svanberg I, Kalle R. 2012. Wild food plant use in 21st century Europe: the disappearance of old traditions and the search for new cuisines involving wild edibles. Acta Societatis Botanicorum Poloniae, 81(4): 359–370.

Departamento de Biología / Universidad Autónoma de Madrid / Spain. Main collaborator – Manuel Pardo-de-Santayana. Non-formal collaboration in the field of economic botany. Joint publications: Pardo-de-Santayana M, Quave CL, Sõukand R, Pieroni A. 2015. Medical ethnobotany and ethnopharmacology of Europe. Michael Heinrich, Anna Jäger (Eds.). Ethnopharmacology - a Reader.Wiley-Blackwell, pp 339–351. Sõukand R, Quave CL, Pieroni A, Pardo-de-Santayana M, Tardío J, Kalle R, Łuczaj Ł, Svanberg I, Kolosova V, Aceituno-Mata L, Menendez G, Kołodziejska-Degórska I, Pirożnikow E, Petkevičius R, Hajdari A, Mustafa B. 2013. Plants used for making recreational tea in Europe: a review based on specific research sites. Journal of Ethnobiology and Ethnomedicine 9: 58. Łuczaj Ł, Pieroni A, Tardío J, Pardo-de-Santayana M, Sõukand R, Svanberg I, Kalle R. 2012. Wild food plant use in 21st century Europe: the disappearance of old traditions and the search for new cuisines involving wild edibles. Acta Societatis Botanicorum Poloniae, 81(4): 359–370.
Elected Council Member for Society for Economic Botany (2014–2016 term)

The Center for Belarusian Culture, Language and Literature Research / Belarussian Academy of Sciences / Belarus. Main collaborator – Tatiana Volodina. Collaboration have been supported by two development cooperation project by Foreign Ministry of Estonia. In May 2016 practical field school in ethnobiology was organized in Luban Region, with participation of 12 young Belarussian scholars. One publication resulting from this collaboration is currently under review: Sõukand et al. 2017. Multi-Functionality of the Few: Current and Past Uses of Wild Plants for Food and Healing in Lubań Region, Belarus. Manuscript submitted to Journal of Ethnobiology and Ethnomedicine. [Under review]

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Principle Investigator for project “HERBA” EKRM06–68, awarded by Research and Development program “Estonian Language and National Memory”. Budget: 27 993 EUR.
Principle Investigator for project “HERBA and satellite databases” awarded by Research and Development program “Estonian Language and Cultural Memory”, EKKM09–84. Budget: 48 878 EUR.

Principle Investigator for project Research and Development program “Estonian Language and Cultural Memory II” “Resource publication of Estonian ethnobotany: interpretation of nature culture“, EKKM14–300.Budget: 55 000 EUR.
Recipient of ERC Starting Grant 2016 by European Research Council. Project ERC-STG-714874-DiGe, title: "Ethnobotany of divided generations in the context of centralization". Budget: 1 496 675 EUR
